entry.title: Causal Inference 0 Introduction
entry.content:
Based on CAUSAL INFERENCE IN STATISTICS: A PRIMER JUDEA PEARL, MADELYN GLYMOUR, NICHOLAS P. JEWELL

Note copied from 饺子博士and饭老师

video link : https://www.bilibili.com/video/BV15J411L7xW/

This note is not complete, only for personal study and website testing.

Simpson’s paradox

Ex: UC Berkeley gender bias

Graduate admissions to UC Berkeley (Fall 1973)

Ex: Cholesterol and Exercise

![[Pasted image 20220510172154.png]]

![[Pasted image 20220510172230.png]]

Explanation

Age is an common cause of both exercise and cholesterol.

graph LR;
	A[Age];
	A --> B[Exercise];
	A --> C[Cholesterol];
	B --> C

Older people, who are more likely to exercise, are also more likely to have cholesterol regardless of excercise

Treatment Effect

subpopulation data

Men

Not Recovered Recovered Total Pr(Recovered)
Trt(1) 6 81 87 81/87 = 0.93
No Trt(2) 36 234 270 234/270 = 0.87

We have P(Recovered,Trt)>P(Recovered,noTrt)P(Recovered, Trt) > P(Recovered, no Trt)P(Recovered,Trt)>P(Recovered,noTrt)

Women

Not Recovered Recovered Total Pr(Recovered)
Trt(3) 71 192 263 192/263 = 0.73
No Trt(4) 25 55 80 55/80 = 0.69

We have also P(Recovered,Trt)>P(Recovered,noTrt)P(Recovered, Trt) > P(Recovered, no Trt)P(Recovered,Trt)>P(Recovered,noTrt)

population data

Not Recovered Recovered Total Pr(Recovered)
Trt(A) 77 273 350 273/350 = 0.78
No Trt(B) 61 289 350 289/350 = 0.83

We have P(Recovered,Trt)<P(Recovered,noTrt)P(Recovered, Trt) < P(Recovered, no Trt)P(Recovered,Trt)<P(Recovered,noTrt)

Explanation

X Y Z
0 Women Not Recovered No Trt
1 Men Recovered Trt

Convex combination

The reason that

A<BA < B A<B

is that large 1−q1-q1−q pull the value of AAA towards (3)(3)(3), which is much smaller than (1)(1)(1), resulting a small value of AAA.

Statement A
1−q=P(X=0∣Z=1)1-q =P(X=0| Z=1)1−q=P(X=0∣Z=1) is large   ⟹  \implies⟹ Drug users are more likely to be women.

Statement B
(3)<(1)(3) < (1)(3)<(1)   ⟹  \implies⟹ Women drug users are less likely to recover than men drug users .

If we randomly select a drug user in popultation, it is more likely to be women, which is more difficult to get recovered, thus it appears this person is more difficult to recover even with treatment.

graph LR;
	A[Sex];
	A --> B[Trt];
	A --> C[Recovered];
	B --> C

entry.title: Causal Inference documents
entry.content:
Course and Textbooks

Introduction to Causal Inference Brady Neal

CAUSAL INFERENCE IN STATISTICS: A PRIMER JUDEA PEARL, MADELYN GLYMOUR, NICHOLAS P. JEWELL

Papers

Generating synthetic text data to evaluate causal inference methods[J]. arXiv preprint arXiv:2102.05638, 2021. Wood-Doughty Z, Shpitser I, Dredze M.

entry.title: Markdown test
entry.content:
A markdown format test page, based on markdown-it test page.

Finally, Markdown-it-plus for emojis, plugins. katex for equations, mermaid for graph, gitalk for comments.

Thankfully, Next theme integrates a lot of third-party package support. And I tried the Gitbook, there is only a web application to write mds, and it was slow… 😦

h1 Heading 😎

h2 Heading

h3 Heading

h4 Heading

h5 Heading
h6 Heading

Horizontal Rules

Typographic replacements

Enable typographer option to see result.

© © ® ® ™ ™ § § ±

test… test… test… test?.. test!..

!!! ??? , – —

“Smartypants, double quotes” and ‘single quotes’

Emphasis

This is bold text

This is bold text

This is italic text

This is italic text

Strikethrough

Blockquotes

Blockquotes can also be nested…

…by using additional greater-than signs right next to each other…

…or with spaces between arrows.

Lists

Unordered

  • Create a list by starting a line with +, -, or *
  • Sub-lists are made by indenting 2 spaces:
    • Marker character change forces new list start:
      • Ac tristique libero volutpat at
      • Facilisis in pretium nisl aliquet
      • Nulla volutpat aliquam velit
  • Very easy!

Ordered

  1. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet

  2. Consectetur adipiscing elit

  3. Integer molestie lorem at massa

  4. You can use sequential numbers…

  5. …or keep all the numbers as 1.

Start numbering with offset:

  1. foo
  2. bar

Code

Inline code

Indented code

// Some comments
line 1 of code
line 2 of code
line 3 of code

Block code “fences”

Syntax highlighting

Tables

Option Description
data path to data files to supply the data that will be passed into templates.
engine engine to be used for processing templates. Handlebars is the default.
ext extension to be used for dest files.

Right aligned columns

Option Description
data path to data files to supply the data that will be passed into templates.
engine engine to be used for processing templates. Handlebars is the default.
ext extension to be used for dest files.

Links

link text

link with title

Autoconverted link https://github.com/nodeca/pica (enable linkify to see)

Math

Note content

NOTE: The note content.

Graph

graph TD;
    A-->B;
    A-->C;
    B-->D;
    C-->D;

Images


Like links, Images also have a footnote style syntax

With a reference later in the document defining the URL location:

Plugins

The killer feature of markdown-it is very effective support of
syntax plugins.

Emojies

Classic markup: 😉 :crush: 😢 :tear: 😆 😋

Shortcuts (emoticons): 😃 😦 😎 😉

see how to change output with twemoji.

Subscript / Superscript

  • 19th
  • H2O

<ins>

Inserted text

<mark>

Marked text

Footnotes

Footnote 1 link[1].

Footnote 2 link[2].

Inline footnote[3] definition.

Duplicated footnote reference[2:1].

Definition lists

Term 1

Definition 1
with lazy continuation.

Term 2 with inline markup

Definition 2

  { some code, part of Definition 2 }

Third paragraph of definition 2.

Compact style:

Term 1
Definition 1
Term 2
Definition 2a
Definition 2b

Abbreviations

This is HTML abbreviation example.

It converts “HTML”, but keep intact partial entries like “xxxHTMLyyy” and so on.

Custom containers

::: warning
here be dragons
:::

  1. Footnote can have markup

    and multiple paragraphs. ↩︎

  2. Footnote text. ↩︎ ↩︎

  3. Text of inline footnote ↩︎
